intro: Lastrea hirtipes, commonly known as the hairy lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
